abstract: Two new books look at the phenomenon of MOOCs, online courses from prestigious universities, most of them free and enrolling throngs of students. An essay in Education Life excerpts one of them.
snippet: Two new books look at the phenomenon of MOOCs, online courses from prestigious universities, most of them free and enrolling throngs of students. An essay in Education Life excerpts one of them.
lead_paragraph: When massive open online courses first made headlines in 2011, they were trumpeted for their potential to reduce costs and expand access to higher learning, especially elite education. So how’s that going so far?

headline.main: A History of MOOCs, Open Online Courses
